text: Talwandi Rajputan is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Talwandi Rajputan. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Talwandi Rajputan has total number of 47 houses and population of 237 of which include 121 males and 116 females. Literacy rate of Talwandi Rajputan is 71.56%, lower than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 19 which is 8.02% of total population of Talwandi Rajputan, and child sex ratio is approximately 583, lower than state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" !
